greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of values of k, 1 <= k <= n, with A033879(k) = A033879(n), where A033879(n) is the deficiency of n, 2n-sigma(n).
comment: Ordinal transform of A033879, or equally, of A033880, or of A286449.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: ordinal_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), pt); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), pt = mapget(om, invec[i]), pt = 0); outvec[i] = (1+pt); mapput(om,invec[i],(1+pt))); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 11 2020
